title: The Lab
text:
#| echo: false import yaml, os, textwrap
with open(‚Äú_data/people.yml‚Äù, ‚Äúr‚Äù) as f: people = yaml.safe_load(f)
def render_people(section): items = people.get(section, []) html = [‚Äô] for p in items: photo = p.get(‚Äúphoto‚Äù, ‚Äú‚Äú) name = p.get(‚Äùname‚Äù, ‚Äú‚Äú) role = p.get(‚Äùrole‚Äù, ‚Äú‚Äú) project = p.get(‚Äùproject‚Äù, ‚Äú‚Äú) interests = p.get(‚Äùinterests‚Äù, []) email = p.get(‚Äúemail‚Äù, ‚Äú‚Äú) links = p.get(‚Äùlinks‚Äù, [])
    html.append('<div class="person-card">')
    if photo:
        html.append(f'<img class="person-photo" src="{photo}" alt="{name}">')
    html.append(f'<div class="person-name">{name}</div>')
    html.append(f'<div class="person-role">{role}</div>')

    if project:
        html.append(f'<div class="person-meta"><strong>Project:</strong> {project}</div>')

    if interests:
        badges = ''.join([f'<span>{i}</span>' for i in interests])
        html.append(f'<div class="badge-list" style="margin-top:0.5rem">{badges}</div>')

    if email:
        html.append(f'<div class="person-meta" style="margin-top:0.6rem"><a href="mailto:{email}">{email}</a></div>')

    if links:
        link_html = " ‚Ä¢ ".join([f'<a href="{l["url"]}" target="_blank">{l["label"]}</a>' for l in links])
        html.append(f'<div class="person-meta" style="margin-top:0.4rem">{link_html}</div>')

    html.append('</div>')
html.append('</div>')
return "\n".join(html)
print(‚Äú## Principal Investigator‚Äù) print(render_people(‚Äúpi‚Äù)) print(‚Äú## Graduate Students‚Äù) print(render_people(‚Äúgrad_students‚Äù)) print(‚Äú## Undergraduate Researchers‚Äù) print(render_people(‚Äúundergrads‚Äù))

title: Research
text:
We identify and isolate core beneficial gut microbes using high-throughput culturing and metagenomics, with applications in probiotic development and gut health optimization.
Why it matters - Reduces production losses by improving gut health and resilience. - Supports antimicrobial stewardship through prevention-focused solutions. - Enables earlier detection and targeted intervention using genomics and analytics.
Deliverables - Curated isolate libraries + functional annotations - Validated biomarkers / signatures for health and disease - Field-ready decision support (sampling ‚Üí sequencing ‚Üí interpretation pipeline)



We investigate virulence mechanisms, host immune responses, and tissue-level pathology to understand bacterial pathogenesis and vaccine targets.



We develop rapid detection and monitoring tools integrating genomics, machine learning, and sensor-based systems for poultry health.

title: Research
section: This work directly benefits producers, veterinarians, integrators, and public health stakeholders by enabling actionable microbial insights that improve animal welfare and reduce the risk of foodborne contamination.

title: Welcome
text:
About the Lab
The Zhang Lab focuses on understanding microbial communities in poultry and food systems to improve animal health, productivity, and food safety. Our work integrates culturomics, genomics, microbiome analysis, and data science.

title: Welcome
text:
Impact
Our lab develops microbiome- and data-driven tools to improve poultry health, productivity, and food safety.
Outcomes include (i) isolating beneficial gut microbes for next-generation probiotics, (ii) identifying mechanisms of avian pathogen virulence and host response, and (iii) deploying scalable monitoring and diagnostic strategies that support disease prevention and antimicrobial stewardship.
